title: Manchester United hero Nemanja Vidic retires from football: 'The injuries have taken their toll'
title_page: Manchester United hero Nemanja Vidic retires from football: 'The injuries have taken their toll' | Daily Mail Online
text:
Former Manchester United defender Nemanja Vidic has retired from football.
The 34-year-old, who spent eight and a half seasons at Old Trafford, has decided to call time on his playing career after leaving Inter Milan by mutual consent earlier this month.
Manchester United, who Vidic captained before moving to Italy in 2014, announced the news of the former Serbia international's retirement with a statement on their official website.
Aston Villa have been offered the chance to sign Nemanja Vidic on a free transfer this January
Vidic played for Manchester United for eight years before leaving for Inter Milan in 2014

Vidic said: 'The time has come for me to hang up my boots,' he said. 'The injuries I have had in the last few years have taken their toll.
'I would like to thank all the players I have played with, all the managers and staff I have worked with, and say a big 'thank you' to the fans for their support over the years.'
Vidic came to an agreement with Inter Milan on January 18 to terminate his contract after 18 months at the San Siro.
The former United skipper had been plagued by injuries â€“ notably hernia and back complaints â€“ throughout his time in Italy.
Vidic helped Manchester United win five Premier League crowns during his time at Old Trafford
Vidic also earned three League Cup winners' medals throughout a trophy-laden spell in England
OLD TRAFFORD HONOURS Premier League â€“ 2006-07, 2007-08, 2008-09, 2010-11, 2012-13 League Cup â€“ 2005-06, 2008-09, 2009-10 Champions League â€“ 2007-08 Club World Cup â€“ 2008
Vidic had not featured at all this season for Inter, who are enjoying a revival under former Manchester City manager Roberto Mancini, after making 28 appearances in the last campaign.
Vidic left United in the summer of 2014 electing to allow his contract to run down after announcing his intention to leave the club midway through the season.
The Serbian - who made 56 appearances for his country - joined United in the 2005-06 season from Spartak Moscow and went on to form a fine centre-back partnership with Rio Ferdinand.
Vidic's time with the Red Devils saw him win the 2007-08 Champions League, plus five Barclays Premier League titles.

Former defensive partner Ferdinand paid tribute to Vidic with a lengthy Facebook post on Friday.
'Where is he from? He is well out of his depth... these were the type of comments flying around the training ground after the 1st few training sessions we saw Vida
'So to see what an unbelievable force he became while at Man Utd means the work he committed himself to physically and mentally is truly huge.
'He became a defender that was feared, he could fight with the most physical, he crunched into tackles, he attacked the ball better than anyone I've ever seen but as he will tell you with a smile, he could also play with the ball too, which made him complete & a great defender.'
Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick tweeted: 'Congrats Vida on an amazing career. I was one of the lucky ones to have played with you. Great memories. Now Golf.'
Defender Phil Jones wrote: 'It was a pleasure to play alongside this man, a player who I always looked up too! A legend. Congrats Vida.'
